strings.Value: "I helped you save your kingdom — will you help me protect mine?"
"Get out of my way, and don't meddle."
"Did the other trolls scare you? What happened?"
"Don't you come close to my capital!"
{n}The old troll is seated on cold tiles. When he sees you, he stands and roars with joy.{/n} "Hmm, {race}! You alive!"

{n}Hargulka shifts from one huge foot to the other for a while before finally spreading his huge hands helplessly.{/n} "Hargulka not know, {name}. Trolls lived in peace, no touch borba... now this. As if forest grew inside dungeons. Strange forest... not like ours. Then dead Tartuk and his trolls appeared."

{n}Hargulka growls in a low, dull tone.{/n} "Branded trolls. There been none since Tartuk died. These ones strange — no smell, no shadows. Alive, but not really. Tartuk is not real, but real angry. Started hissing about {g|Trobold}Trobold{/g}, treason, borb- you." {n}The old troll lowers his head.{/n} "Hargulka deceived Tartuk. Said must think and decide. Hargulka waited. Not want to fight all Tartuk's trolls. But not betray you, no!"

"Many ran away. Others hid. Rest fought Tartuk's trolls. Some stayed alive and ran, and some got eaten. A few agreed with Tartuk, went back to like before." {n}Hargulka lets out a rumble of disapproval.{/n}

{n}Hargulka's roar shakes the dungeon walls.{/n} "Hargulka promised help! Strong word! Hargulka will gather his trolls, go to your city. You protected {g|Trobold}Trobold{/g} — we will protect your kingdom!"
{n}Hargulka lingers.{/n} "Leave...? Hargulka want to help... gather an army... go to city and fight your enemies..."

{n}Hargulka looks at you, clearly confused and... maybe hurt?{/n} "Hargulka was not lying when he promised friendship. If kingdom does not need trolls, then trolls will save trolls. Farewell, {name}."
{n}Hargulka stands up and straightens his shoulders with a crunching sound.{/n} "We will crush your enemies! Hargulka gave his word! Strong word!"
